6f3be19b15c0d946d464e2c16088b16a (14:32): but then i change it somehow?
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:33): It's cool right now
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:34): I should be trying to get my windows box working before it gets all hot
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:34): but i wasted like 4 hours of cool time
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:34): so maybe i'll wait until another day

e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:40): A Song? On google video?!
767e90dbc16c400ad03bbd819b971578 (14:40): Dreamer3: ctrl+apple+4, then space, then click the window with the camera.
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:40): Get out the RIAA C&D
6f3be19b15c0d946d464e2c16088b16a (14:40): Spanko: yeah, i found it :-)
767e90dbc16c400ad03bbd819b971578 (14:40): shift+apple+4 even
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:40): Nothing like a couple of hotdogs with cheese onion and some spicy mustard at 5:30am
767e90dbc16c400ad03bbd819b971578 (14:40): Cool. I sort of miss Print Screen, but somehow I manage to remember this shortcut :p
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:41): if I had bacon I would have tossed some of that up in here, and replaced mustard with ketchup and dropped the onions
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:41): well, maybe i would have kept the onions
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:41): I would have had an extra two minutes waiting for the bacon to chop and onion
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:41): it's hard to say as I don't have bacon
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:41): only sausage and scrapple
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:41): and they don't go well with hotdogs

e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:46): this fucking many many year old drifting balance issue is fucking annoying
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:46): The sound?
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:47): Oh, it's really an issue? General one?
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:47): PHew, I thought only m ine had it.
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:47): Like last year, when I got my PB (first Mac)
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:47): i noticed it happening
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:47): and searched for it
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:47): After a while, my left speaker didn't work anymore...
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:47): it's been a problem for at least 4 years
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:47): So I was like fuck... it's broken.
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:48): apparently it's using the volume keys at high cpu usage that does it
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:48): Returned it to the store, took them 10 days to fix it!
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:48): but i've seen it happen under low loads
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:48): When I went to get it they told me, my balance was shifted.
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:48): yeah I just happened to have my sound prefs up one day while playing with mic volume and stuff
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:48): and i noticed it drift
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:48): So I was like mad at my bro, because he had touched it and probabyl shifted the balance.
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:49): Because I hadn't touched it.
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:49): I had to miss my PB for 10 days, something I could fix with just sliding the bar back.
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:49): (but I didn't know it was an issue back then, neither that I could change the balance, I was new to Mac)
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:50): You know what sucks even more?
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:50): Not being able to mute your mic.
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:50): Mute it and hop, it starts sliding back.

fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:51): Very annoying... Sometimes people skype me, and because there's too much background noise (people in the room) I tell them to just talk to me, I'll mute my mic and type back.
fd32acd333d33aac1ae504785b15390c (14:52): But it doesn't work as the mic doesn't stay silenced :|
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:53): Front Row follows symlinks for ~/Movies
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:54): I had a folder for movies on my desktop
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:54): I keep movies on my external drive.
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:54): and was like 'hrms i wonder if i could put a symlink to it in ~movies
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:54): then eventually was like 'wtf i'm just going to put the movies in ~/movies' and sym link the desktop
e5130390755c40f095aa1149e6fc7707 (14:54): since That's the way I had it with ~/Documents already
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:54): Well, my movies are on Data:Movies\
767e90dbc16c400ad03bbd819b971578 (14:54): Though what happens when you disconnect the external drive? I expect Front Row still lists them?
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:55): The external drive is a network share to that box right now =]
767e90dbc16c400ad03bbd819b971578 (14:55): Front Row/iTunes still lists the music from my external drive when it's not connected. Kind of lame.
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:56): I need codecs though =/
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:57): DivX 6 is like a 30 day trial.
677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:57): DivX Community Codec, part of the DivX for Mac download (free and has a 6-month trial of the DivX Pro Codec)
